content.description: Consider a population consisting of four children with ages, in years, of <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="11" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The population mean age is <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years, and the population variance is <math alttext="10.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> square years.
content.question: For simple random samples of size <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> taken with replacement, what are the mean and standard deviation of the sampling distribution of the sample mean age, in years?

choices.label: Mean <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="5.25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Mean <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="2.29" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.29</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Mean <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="4.24" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.24</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Mean <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="2.29" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.29</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Mean <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="1.87" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.87</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: Mean <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="2.29" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.29</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
